intro: Ctenitis oreocharis, commonly known as the mountain tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, feather-like fronds. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments, typically in forested areas with high humidity. Its fronds are pinnately compound, with a distinctive arrangement of pinnae that give it a unique appearance. Ctenitis oreocharis plays an important role in its native ecosystem, providing habitat and contributing to forest biodiversity.
